name: 林文印
objective:
Change, complexity, uncertainty and conflict are often central in environmental management. They can create opportunities as well as problems for analysts, planners, managers, decision makers and members of the public.
Human activity can contribute to environmental degradation. To be effective analysts, it is important to be able to identify and understand the differing and often conflicting pressures placed on policy makers, and the implications for the intent and output of policies.
schedule:
1 Introduction
2 Characteristics of Environmental Problems
3 Sustainable Development
4 Energy and Environment
5 Green Community
6 Oral Presentations
scorePolicy:
1. Class Participation 40%
2. Homework 20%
3. Term Paper & Presentation 40%
materials:
1. Environmental Planning and Management, Christian N. Madu, Imperial College Press, 2007.
2. Power point handouts
consultation: Please email Professor Lin (wylin@ntut.edu.tw) to discuss or arrange meeting.
課程對應SDGs指標: SDG6：潔淨水與衛生（Clean Water and Sanitation）SDG7：可負擔的潔淨能源（Affordable and Clean Energy）SDG11：永續城市與社區（Sustainable Cities and Communities）SDG12：負責任的消費與生產（Responsible Consumption and Production）SDG13：氣候行動（Climate Action）SDG14：水下生命（Life below Water）SDG15：陸域生命（Life on Land）SDG17：夥伴關係（Partnerships for the Goals）
課程是否導入AI: AI4：簡單介紹 AI 的基本概念（Briefly introduce the basic concept of AI）
remarks: 課程內容可能涉及聯合國 17 項永續發展目標 (SDGs)：目標 6 Clean Water and Sanitation、目標 7 Affordable and Clean Energy、目標 11 Sustainable Cities and Communities、目標 12 Responsible Consumption and Production、目標 13 Climate Action、目標 14 Life Below Water、目標 15 Life on Land、目標 17 Partnerships for the Goals。

name: 胡憲倫
objective:
學生將會學習從較宏觀的視野來認識屬於人文與社會層面的環境管理。課程將會透過系統思考及永續創新的角度，來反思地球的現在與未來；闡述新經濟時代的來臨與綠色資本主義的重要性及其四種策略，來緩解氣候變遷及全球暖化的趨勢，創造企業競爭優勢，並開創人類永續發展的新契機。
Students will be guided from a broader and global perspective to learn the social and human aspects of protecting the Earth. Lectures will cover systems thinking and its importance to Sustainable Development. Innovative and emerging technologies for sustainability and "net zero" emissions will be explored. Natural Capitalism and its strategies, Circular Economy, and the Bottom (Base) of the Pyramid (BoP) theory will also be taught to help strive for a sustainable future.
schedule:
Week 1 導論 - 資本主義與永續發展 (綠色資本主義 / 永續發展目標)
             Introduction- Capitalism and Sustainable Development/Natural Capitalism and Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)
Week 2 系統思考與系統化管理 (Systems Thinking and Environmental & Sustainable Systems Management)
Week 3 永續創新及生物模擬－師法自然 Sustainable Innovation and Learning from Nature- Biomimicry
Week 4 服務與流動的經濟 (產品服務系統) 及循環經濟 Product Service System (PSS)& Circular Economy
Week 5 金字塔底層及包容性經濟 Bottom of the Pyramid (BOP) & Inclusive Business
Week 6 結語及分組報告 (Conclusion and Group Presentation)
scorePolicy: Homework: 45%    Group Presentation：40%   Class Participation & Discussion 15%
materials:
1.	Meadows, D. (2008). Thinking in Systems: A Primer, Chelsea Green Publishing (邱昭良譯，系統思考，經濟新潮社，2016)
2.	Lovins, A.B. Lovins, L.H. and P. Hawken, A Roadmap for Natural Capitalism, Harvard Business Review, May-June, 145-158, 1999
3.	Senge et al., The Necessary Revolution- How Individuals and Organizations are Working Together to Create a Sustainable World, The Doubleday Publishing Group, 2008 (齊若蘭譯，Peter Senge 原著，必要的革命 - 個人與組織如何共創永續社會，天下文化，2010)
4.	Papers assigned for the class
consultation: 每週三下午 13:00~17:00, 或是透過事前的 e-mail 預約.Every Wednesday afternoon, or by e-mail appointment.
課程對應SDGs指標: SDG1：消除貧窮（No Poverty）SDG3：良好健康和福祉（Good Health and Well-being）SDG9：產業創新與基礎設施（Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure）SDG10：減少不平等（Reduced Inequalities）SDG12：負責任的消費與生產（Responsible Consumption and Production）SDG16：和平正義與有力的制度（Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions）SDG17：夥伴關係（Partnerships for the Goals）
